Comment: From Joseph MacBeth is president of the National Alliance of Direct Support Professionals:  "For more than six decades, the Kennedys were not just allies but architects of the disability rights movement. That’s why it’s so deeply painful—and profoundly ironic—that a Kennedy is now supporting policies that would dismantle what his own family so fiercely built.  Robert F. Kennedy, Jr., there is still time to lead with courage. You can still reverse your endorsement of cuts to Medicaid—cuts that would strip $880 billion from a program that provides vital services to children, the elderly, and people with disabilities."  Read more: [https://www.pennlive.com/opinion/2025/04/rfk-jr-your-family-fought-for-disability-rights-why-wont-you-opinion.html?utm\_medium=social&utm\_source=redditsocial&utm\_campaign=redditor](https://www.pennlive.com/opinion/2025/04/rfk-jr-your-family-fought-for-disability-rights-why-wont-you-opinion.html?utm_medium=social&utm_source=redditsocial&utm_campaign=redditor)
